column2: HI DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers of large vehicles:
column4: are only responsible for their vehicle and its cargo.
column6: have the right-of-way over smaller vehicles.
column8: generally have better visibility to the sides and rear.
column10: have the responsibility to give proper consideration to other highway users as well as to their passengers and cargo.

column2: 2. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column8: red warning lights.

column2: 3. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 4. Who is most at risk?
column8: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 5. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
6. Which of the following is true?
column4: Pedestrians should look for turning vehicles before crossing the street.
column6: Pedestrians should never run across the street.
column8: Pedestrians should walk on the left side of the street facing traffic.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: Tow away zone

column2: 8. All headlights on your vehicle must work properly and be correctly adjusted:
column8: at all times.

column2: 9. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column6: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.
column8: is used at dangerous intersections.

column2: 10. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column6: Immediately come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop

column2: 11. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column8: have no driving errors.
column10: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 12. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.
column8: using the inside rearview mirror.
column10: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.

column2: 13. Studies show that wearing seat belts:
column4: reduces your chances of damaging your car in a crash.
column6: increases your chances of fatality in a crash.
column8: reduces your chances of serious injury in a crash.

column2: 14. This is:
column8: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 15. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light
column8: finish crossing the street.

column2: 16. If your power steering fails, you should:
column4: work hard to steer, reduce speed, drive to a safe area and stop.
column8: turn on your hazard warning lights and brace yourself.
column10: honk the horn and turn off the ignition.

column2: 17. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column10: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.

column2: 18. Aggressive drivers:
column6: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.
column8: are high risk drivers.

column2: 19. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: No one.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 21. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column6: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column8: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column10: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.

column2: 22. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column6: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.
column8: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.

column2: 23. A leaky exhaust system in your vehicle is dangerous because it can cause:
column8: pollution.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column8: No left turn

column2: 25. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column6: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column8: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column10: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column8: The road ahead is closed to traffic

column2: 27. Parking is not allowed:
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column10: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.

column2: 28. You may pass a school bus from the front or rear on an undivided roadway:
column4: when the red lamps on the school bus are flashing.
column8: at anytime, if you go slow.
column10: when the red lamps on the school bus are not flashing.

column2: 29. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: Brake early and gently.

column2: 30. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column8: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column10: Take a cold shower before driving.
